column2: '09Oct'
column3: 2)	" Yes. President Clinton addressed this issue when he said
column4: ""Mend it
column5: don't end it."" Diversity is a great strength in America. Look around the world at other places where they have not paid attention to the necessity of promoting harmony of
column6: between different ethnic
column7: racial and religious
column8: and cultural groups. We ought to be very proud in our country
column9: as most Americans are
column10: that we've made tremendous progress
column11: but we ought to recognize that we have more work to do. Now
column12: the first thing that we are trying to do is to create a million new jobs in the inner cities of this country
column13: with tax credits for employers who hire people who are now unemployed. We are seeking to have vigorous enforcement of the laws that bar discrimination. Now
column14: I want to congratulate Mr. Kemp for being a lonely voice in the Republican party over the years on this question. It is -- it is with some sadness that I refer to the fact that the day after he joined Senator Dole's ticket
column15: he announced that he was changing his position and was hereto
column16: thereafter going to adopt Senator Dole's position to end all affirmative action. That's not good for our country. Bill Clinton and I believe that the United States of America has its brightest days ahead
column17: and we will see them even brighter if we promote diversity and harmony among all our people.

column2: my position on Affirmative Action has been clear ever since I left the professional football career for Congress in 1970. Some people think I quit playing a few years earlier
column3: but I retired in 1970. My life has been dedicated to equality of opportunity and our democracy should provide that
column4: not equality of reward. Uh
column5: Affirmative Action should be predicated upon need
column6: not equality of reward
column7: not equality of outcome. Quotas have always been against the American ideal. We should promote diversity and we should do it the way Bob Dole has been talking about
column8: with a new civil rights agenda
column9: based upon expanding access to credit and capital
column10: job opportunities
column11: educational choice in our inner cities for a young urban mother who can't get the type of an education she wants for her child
column12: and
column13: ultimately
column14: the type of ownership and entrepreneurship from public housing in
column15: D.C. to Nickerson Gardens in Watts
column16: Los Angeles. People need to own. And that's what Abraham Lincoln believed. That when people own something
column17: they have a stake in the American dream. That is Affirmative Action in America.

column2: I do not believe that Abraham Lincoln would have adopted Bob Dole's position to end all affirmative action. There is a specific measure on the ballot in California. It was embodied in legislation
column3: introduced by Senator Dole
column4: to apply to the whole nation. Mr. Kemp campaigned against it
column5: spoke against it
column6: wrote letters against it
column7: went to California to fight against it
column8: and now has endorsed it. I don't think it's a minor matter. I think this is one of the most important challenges that our country has to face in the future
column9: and I hope that Mr. Kemp will try to persuade Senator Dole to adopt Mr. Kemp's position
column10: instead of the other way around.

right. I can't believe I'm keeping within the time limit.

column2: '09Oct'
column3: 3)	" Yeah
column4: we really do. Um
column5: this country has yet to deal with the type of inclusionary policies. It is so very important for Americans
column6: white and black
column7: Jew and Christian
column8: immigrant and native-born
column9: to sit down and talk and listen and begin to understand what it's like to come from that different perspective. Our country is as the Kerner Commission Report suggested a number of years ago was being split
column10: but they said between white and black. I think it's being split
column11: Jim
column12: not so much between white and black
column13: although that's still a very serious problem. We really have two economies. Our general economy
column14: our national economy
column15: our mainstream economy is democratic
column16: is based on incentives
column17: a small ""d"" Al
column18: it's capitalism and incentives for working and saving and investing and producing
column19: and families and the things that really lead to progress up that ladder that we call ""The American Dream
column20: but is what is really universal. But unfortunately
column22: and I was glad to hear the Vice President talk a little bit about it
column23: uh there -- they have abandoned the inner cities. There's a socialist economy. There's no private housing. There's mostly public housing. You're told where to go to school
column24: you're told what to buy with food stamps. It is a welfare system that is more like a third-world socialist country than what we would expect from the world's greatest democratic free-enterprise system. That must change
column25: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: Remember what I said just a moment ago. If it were not so
column2: he would have told you. The problems between races in America must be addressed. The good news is we're making progress. We've seen 10.5 million new jobs created in the last four years. We've seen the unemployment rate come down dramatically. We've seen the African-American unemployment rate go below double digits for the first time in 25 years and it stayed below for 25 months in a row. We have empowerment zones and enterprise communities
column3: 105 of them in communities all across the United States of America. Let me tell you a story about Joann Crowder in Detroit. She was on welfare for eight years until the empowerment zone was created there. She just got a job in the new business that -- that launched its enterprise right in that empowerment zone. We want to do that for millions more all across the country.

column2: with all due respect
column3: Jim
column4: there are nine empowerment zones
column5: a few little tinkering with tax credits around the country for inner cities. Los Angeles
column6: after the riots
column7: did not even get an empowerment zone
column8: believe it or not. That is just unconscionable in America to have left Watts
column9: South Central and East L.A. out. Earl Graves of ""Black Enterprise"" magazine said the single greatest deterrent to black advancement is the lack of access to capital
column10: the credit and ownership. That will change. We will green-line every city in the United States where there is unemployment and welfare and we will eliminate the Capital Gains Tax
column11: eliminate the tax on a welfare mother that takes a job. That is the answer. Give ownership and entrepreneurship to low income people based on need
column12: not the color of their skin.

column1: Before I answer that specific question
column2: let me say that we did put an empowerment zone in South Central
column3: Los Angeles. It is in the form of the largest community development financial institution ever created in the United States or in any other country and it is creating jobs in South Central
column4: Los Angeles right now. The Congress passed uh an enterprise zone after the Los Angeles riots five years ago. It was vetoed by the prior administration. Now
column5: to your question. We have a specific plan to create 1 million new jobs in the inner cities of America with tax credits for employers who hire people coming off welfare
column6: 'cause we've passed welfare reform now
column7: we promised to end welfare as we know it. And we are implementing this new legislation. We have moved 1.9 million people off of the welfare rolls and into good jobs in the last four years. Our new plan is to have 1 million more jobs in the inner cities
column8: but that's not all. We are also implementing the plan to put 100
column9: 000 community police officers in our cities. We've already got 20
column10: 000 out there. We're ahead of our six-year schedule. As a matter of fact
column11: there're 8 here in St. Petersburg
column12: already on the beat
column13: you may run into one of them leaving this auditorium tonight. St. Petersburg is safer because of this urban agenda that we're following. We want the focus to be on millions more jobs
column14: and we're very optimistic that it's gonna happen.

column2: we've had four years and there's no enterprise zone. There are empowerment zones
column3: but you have to do what Bill Clinton and Al Gore want you to do. You get a $5
column4: 000 tax credit if you hire somebody that's unemployed
column5: but you've already got to have an existing business. The answer is to say
column6: once again
column7: green-line any area in America that has been red-lined for lack of mortgage money
column8: lack of credit and capital. Just say that area qualifies for no Capital Gains Tax
column9: zero
column10: nada. That's what Eleanor Holmes Norton wants to do in the District of Columbia and this administration said to D.C.
column11: Drop dead. Drop dead. We don't want to change the legislation that would lower the tax rate in D.C.
column12: allow welfare mothers to take a job without any tax on the first 90 percent of her income and no Capital Gain Tax that should be done in every urban area of America that would make capital flow back
column13: and you can't have capitalism
column14: Al
column15: without capital. You may want to give a tax credit
column16: but it won't work.

column2: we have 105 empowerment zones and enterprise communities all across the United States of America
column3: and with all due respect
column4: that's 105 more than were there when we came into the White House. We have been implementing them in a determined way. They are making a difference. You know
column5: that empowerment zone that I mentioned in Detroit is creating jobs not only for Joann Crowder
column6: who feels proud that she's off of welfare now
column7: and we're proud of her. It's creating jobs for hundreds of others
column8: and similar initiatives are working in the other empowerment zones.

column1: The single greatest problem in our opinion
column2: domestic -- in the domestic economy
column3: is that this tax code
column4: 83 years old
column5: a relic of the Cold War and Hot War
column6: inflation and depression
column7: seven-and-a-half million words long
column8: overtaxes capital
column9: overtaxes working men and women and families. Clearly
column10: the Gordian knot needs to be broken in one fell swoop. Bob Dole and Jack Kemp
column11: as soon as we get through this first step of cutting tax rates across the board
column12: are going to repeal the whole code while Bill Clinton and my friend
column13: Al Gore
column14: defend the status quo. We're going to repeal the seven-and-a-half million words of the U.S.tax code
column15: make it tax income once
column16: not twice
column17: three
column18: four
column19: and if you die
column20: it confiscates your estate. We must have a tax code going into the 21st Century that does not protect the establishment and this tax code does. And by cutting and eliminating the Capital Gains
column21: by cutting and eliminating the Estate Tax
column22: by bringing the top tax rate down to something reasonable
column23: like -- here he goes again -- I think in peacetime
column24: it shouldn't be higher
column25: Bob
column26: and I don't think it should be higher than 25 percent
column27: phased in. But capital would flow out into the economy. We have people getting access to capital. Small businessmen and women
column28: African-American
column30: Latino Americans
column31: female Americans would be able to start their businesses. Dana Crist of Lancaster said the day the tax bill is passed in Congress
column32: she will open a new factory with 40 or 50 or 60 employees in Lancaster
column33: Pennsylvania. He'll call that trickle down. I'll call it Niagara Falls.

column1: The problem with this version of Niagara Falls is that Senator Dole and Mr. Kemp would put the economy in a barrel and send it over the falls. [ Laughter ] It is a risky
column2: $550-billion tax scheme that actually raises taxes on 9 million of the hardest working families. Again
column3: Mr. Kemp opposed that and called it unconscionable. Now
column4: it is part of the plan that he is supporting. Not only that
column5: though
column6: it would blow a hole in the deficit
column7: it would raise interest rates. That means higher mortgage payments
column8: particularly those with the variable rate mortgages
column9: higher car payments
column10: he would also lead to much deeper cuts in Medicare
column11: Medicaid
column12: education and the environment. It is extremely risky. And as for these harsh words
column13: I don't take them personally. He said much worse about Bob Dole when he said Bob Dole never met a tax that he didn't hike. He wrote about 450 separate provisions in that code. You better check with him before you eliminate it completely. He may be getting royalties.

column2: a $550-billion tax cut
column3: this is something that Al does not want to mention
column4: has to be viewed against the context of a $50-trillion U.S. economy output of goods and services over the next six years. A $550-billion tax cut in a $50-trillion economy over six years is one-and-a-half percent
column5: and the only hole it would blow is a hole in the plans of this administration to try to tinker with the tax code and defend the indefensible. It would blow up the bureaucracy
column6: but you would expand the economy. That's important for America.

column1: We've passed the Taxpayer Bill of Rights. We have fought for new provisions that now make it possible to file over the telephone. We are fighting for tax reforms across-the-board
column2: and most importantly
column3: we have a plan on the table right now to cut taxes on middle income families with several specific provisions. We already cut taxes on 15 million working families in this county
column4: with an average of about $1
column5: 000 in tax relief to those making $25
column6: 000 a year or less. And for the last two years
column7: we have had middle-income tax cuts on the table in the Congress and they would not -- they weren't accepted by Bob Dole and Newt Gingrich
column8: because they said they would not pass them without cutting deeply into Medicare
column9: Medicaid
column10: education and the environment. We are determined to move forward during these next four years
column11: with the tax cuts that president Bill Clinton has proposed. Here they are again: A $1500 tax credit for tuition
column13: 000 tax deduction so that no family pays taxes on the money for college tuition
column14: capital gains eliminated for the sale of a home
column15: a tax break for first-time home buyers and for health care expenses and a $500 child tax credit.

column1: You only get a tax cut in the Clinton administration if you do exactly what Al Gore and Bill Clinton want you to do. That's not America. When John F. Kennedy cut tax rates
column2: the economy grew
column3: unemployment went down and we balanced the budget
column4: and revenues went up. Indeed
column5: the Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy and the Deputy Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy endorsed Bob Dole's plan to cut rates
column6: cut the Capital Gains Tax
column7: balance the budget
column8: provide a $500 tax credit
column9: and
column10: clearly
column11: the plan should be to lift the economy
column12: to get more revenues. Medicare will be saved because it will be put into a commission where both Bill Clinton and Bob Dole recognize it has to be studied by the same people that would study -- or did study
column13: I should say
column14: the Social Security System and saved it in 1983 and '84. Look
column15: we can bring down government -- the growth of government spending
column16: but we have to grow the economy. And in Bob Dole and Jack Kemp's opinion
column17: we should aim at doubling the size of the American economy in the next 15 years. Under their policies
column18: it will take 30 to 40 years. That's not acceptable.

column1: The chairman of their national campaign steering committee
column2: Senator D'Amato
column3: said that Bob Dole would have to cut into Medicare in order to pay for this proposal
column4: but that he would wait until after the election to do it. The proposal to cut Medicare that Senator Dole pushed before
column5: and shut down the government to try to enact
column6: would have already raised by $268
column7: the fees paid by the average couple now on Medicare. He tried to double the deductibles and give people less in return. We have a balanced budget plan that protects Medicare and gives tax cuts.

column2: Jim
column3: let me just say it is disgraceful
column4: the campaign being waged to scare the American senior citizens
column5: in this state and my home state of
column6: well
column7: New York and California
column8: about Medicare.

column2: isn't there?
Maryland now. The amount of money being spent to try to mislead the American people is demagoguery
column3: and only in the Clinton White House and in Al Gore's mind could an increase in spending per capita on a senior citizen from $4800 in 1996 to $7200 over the next five years be considered a cut. Does anybody think that Bob Dole
column4: who almost gave his life for his country
column5: who has served in the Senate
column6: who helped save Social Security
column7: crawled out of a fox hole on Riva Ridge in Northern Italy in 1945 to save a wounded radioman? Does anybody think in this country that he could possibly want to move our country ahead and leave anybody behind? Of course
column8: we can balance the budget. Of course
column9: we have to hold down the growth in entitlement spending. But clearly
column10: you cannot balance the budget
column11: Jim
column12: without growing this economy. It's only growing at about two-and-a-half percent. We should double the rate of growth and double the size of American economy. This means more jobs
column13: more wealth
column14: more income and more capital
column15: particularly for our nation's poor and those left behind.

column2: our balanced budget plan extends the Medicare Trust Fund ten years into the future. A commission is fine
column3: but a commission would not do any good if we adopted this risky $550-billion tax scheme. The word ""scary"" has been used. A couple of days ago I went with Governor Lawton Chiles
column4: who was here
column5: to Sarasota to the Friendship Senior Center. I talked with a woman there named Dorothy Wornell and she said
column6: ""You know
column7: we may not be as sophisticated as some of those people in Washington
column8: but we can add and subtract."" Here are the numbers she's adding and subtracting. Bob Dole's plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple
column9: and his plan would have doubled deductibles. It would have cost an extra $1
column10: 700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors. Bill Clinton prevented it from happening. We will never allow that to happen.

column2: Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue. It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight. By the President's own trustees of Medicare
column3: three members of which serve in his cabinet
column4: it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998. Something must be done. Bob Dole is -- has suggested a commission
column5: but
column6: clearly
column7: you cannot save Medicare
column8: Social Security
column9: or any program for the social welfare net of American people
column10: under which they should not be allowed to fall
column11: unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today. That is the issue
column12: not scaring people in America.

column2: as I said before
column3: he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole. He said that Bob Dole's solution for every single problem was to increase taxes. He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world
column4: but let's get to the point. Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965. Bob Dole
column5: incidentally
column6: just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place. I don't think he's -- he didn't believe in it then
column7: and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare. Again
column8: don't take my word for it. The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals. The Catholic Health Association
column9: the AARP
column10: and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts
column11: possibly set up a two-tiered system
column12: and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have. Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future. We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan.

column2: they have no plan. They have absolutely no plan. The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan
column3: irrespective of the numbers
column4: it will grow at 7 or even more percent
column5: but that is beside the point. What has to be discussed is how we
column6: as a nation
column7: are going to create the size of an economy
column8: create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy. We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people. Another trillion dollars of revenue
column9: with which to save Medicare and Social Security. And you can't do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits
column10: as this administration is allowing to happen. That has to change
column11: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

column10: the Gordian knot needs to be broken in one fell swoop. Bob Dole and Jack Kemp
column11: as soon as we get through this first step of cutting tax rates across the board
column12: are going to repeal the whole code while Bill Clinton and my friend
column13: Al Gore
column14: defend the status quo. We're going to repeal the seven-and-a-half million words of the U.S.tax code
column15: make it tax income once
column16: not twice
column17: three
column18: four
column19: and if you die
column20: it confiscates your estate. We must have a tax code going into the 21st Century that does not protect the establishment and this tax code does. And by cutting and eliminating the Capital Gains
column21: by cutting and eliminating the Estate Tax
column22: by bringing the top tax rate down to something reasonable
column23: like -- here he goes again -- I think in peacetime
column24: it shouldn't be higher
column25: Bob
column26: and I don't think it should be higher than 25 percent
column27: phased in. But capital would flow out into the economy. We have people getting access to capital. Small businessmen and women
column28: African-American
column30: Latino Americans
column31: female Americans would be able to start their businesses. Dana Crist of Lancaster said the day the tax bill is passed in Congress
column32: she will open a new factory with 40 or 50 or 60 employees in Lancaster
column33: Pennsylvania. He'll call that trickle down. I'll call it Niagara Falls.

column1: The problem with this version of Niagara Falls is that Senator Dole and Mr. Kemp would put the economy in a barrel and send it over the falls. [ Laughter ] It is a risky
column2: $550-billion tax scheme that actually raises taxes on 9 million of the hardest working families. Again
column3: Mr. Kemp opposed that and called it unconscionable. Now
column4: it is part of the plan that he is supporting. Not only that
column5: though
column6: it would blow a hole in the deficit
column7: it would raise interest rates. That means higher mortgage payments
column8: particularly those with the variable rate mortgages
column9: higher car payments
column10: he would also lead to much deeper cuts in Medicare
column11: Medicaid
column12: education and the environment. It is extremely risky. And as for these harsh words
column13: I don't take them personally. He said much worse about Bob Dole when he said Bob Dole never met a tax that he didn't hike. He wrote about 450 separate provisions in that code. You better check with him before you eliminate it completely. He may be getting royalties.

column2: a $550-billion tax cut
column3: this is something that Al does not want to mention
column4: has to be viewed against the context of a $50-trillion U.S. economy output of goods and services over the next six years. A $550-billion tax cut in a $50-trillion economy over six years is one-and-a-half percent
column5: and the only hole it would blow is a hole in the plans of this administration to try to tinker with the tax code and defend the indefensible. It would blow up the bureaucracy
column6: but you would expand the economy. That's important for America.

column1: We've passed the Taxpayer Bill of Rights. We have fought for new provisions that now make it possible to file over the telephone. We are fighting for tax reforms across-the-board
column2: and most importantly
column3: we have a plan on the table right now to cut taxes on middle income families with several specific provisions. We already cut taxes on 15 million working families in this county
column4: with an average of about $1
column5: 000 in tax relief to those making $25
column6: 000 a year or less. And for the last two years
column7: we have had middle-income tax cuts on the table in the Congress and they would not -- they weren't accepted by Bob Dole and Newt Gingrich
column8: because they said they would not pass them without cutting deeply into Medicare
column9: Medicaid
column10: education and the environment. We are determined to move forward during these next four years
column11: with the tax cuts that president Bill Clinton has proposed. Here they are again: A $1500 tax credit for tuition
column13: 000 tax deduction so that no family pays taxes on the money for college tuition
column14: capital gains eliminated for the sale of a home
column15: a tax break for first-time home buyers and for health care expenses and a $500 child tax credit.

column1: You only get a tax cut in the Clinton administration if you do exactly what Al Gore and Bill Clinton want you to do. That's not America. When John F. Kennedy cut tax rates
column2: the economy grew
column3: unemployment went down and we balanced the budget
column4: and revenues went up. Indeed
column5: the Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy and the Deputy Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy endorsed Bob Dole's plan to cut rates
column6: cut the Capital Gains Tax
column7: balance the budget
column8: provide a $500 tax credit
column9: and
column10: clearly
column11: the plan should be to lift the economy
column12: to get more revenues. Medicare will be saved because it will be put into a commission where both Bill Clinton and Bob Dole recognize it has to be studied by the same people that would study -- or did study
column13: I should say
column14: the Social Security System and saved it in 1983 and '84. Look
column15: we can bring down government -- the growth of government spending
column16: but we have to grow the economy. And in Bob Dole and Jack Kemp's opinion
column17: we should aim at doubling the size of the American economy in the next 15 years. Under their policies
column18: it will take 30 to 40 years. That's not acceptable.

column1: The chairman of their national campaign steering committee
column2: Senator D'Amato
column3: said that Bob Dole would have to cut into Medicare in order to pay for this proposal
column4: but that he would wait until after the election to do it. The proposal to cut Medicare that Senator Dole pushed before
column5: and shut down the government to try to enact
column6: would have already raised by $268
column7: the fees paid by the average couple now on Medicare. He tried to double the deductibles and give people less in return. We have a balanced budget plan that protects Medicare and gives tax cuts.

column2: Jim
column3: let me just say it is disgraceful
column4: the campaign being waged to scare the American senior citizens
column5: in this state and my home state of
column6: well
column7: New York and California
column8: about Medicare.

column2: isn't there?
Maryland now. The amount of money being spent to try to mislead the American people is demagoguery
column3: and only in the Clinton White House and in Al Gore's mind could an increase in spending per capita on a senior citizen from $4800 in 1996 to $7200 over the next five years be considered a cut. Does anybody think that Bob Dole
column4: who almost gave his life for his country
column5: who has served in the Senate
column6: who helped save Social Security
column7: crawled out of a fox hole on Riva Ridge in Northern Italy in 1945 to save a wounded radioman? Does anybody think in this country that he could possibly want to move our country ahead and leave anybody behind? Of course
column8: we can balance the budget. Of course
column9: we have to hold down the growth in entitlement spending. But clearly
column10: you cannot balance the budget
column11: Jim
column12: without growing this economy. It's only growing at about two-and-a-half percent. We should double the rate of growth and double the size of American economy. This means more jobs
column13: more wealth
column14: more income and more capital
column15: particularly for our nation's poor and those left behind.

column2: our balanced budget plan extends the Medicare Trust Fund ten years into the future. A commission is fine
column3: but a commission would not do any good if we adopted this risky $550-billion tax scheme. The word ""scary"" has been used. A couple of days ago I went with Governor Lawton Chiles
column4: who was here
column5: to Sarasota to the Friendship Senior Center. I talked with a woman there named Dorothy Wornell and she said
column6: ""You know
column7: we may not be as sophisticated as some of those people in Washington
column8: but we can add and subtract."" Here are the numbers she's adding and subtracting. Bob Dole's plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple
column9: and his plan would have doubled deductibles. It would have cost an extra $1
column10: 700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors. Bill Clinton prevented it from happening. We will never allow that to happen.

column2: Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue. It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight. By the President's own trustees of Medicare
column3: three members of which serve in his cabinet
column4: it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998. Something must be done. Bob Dole is -- has suggested a commission
column5: but
column6: clearly
column7: you cannot save Medicare
column8: Social Security
column9: or any program for the social welfare net of American people
column10: under which they should not be allowed to fall
column11: unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today. That is the issue
column12: not scaring people in America.

column2: as I said before
column3: he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole. He said that Bob Dole's solution for every single problem was to increase taxes. He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world
column4: but let's get to the point. Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965. Bob Dole
column5: incidentally
column6: just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place. I don't think he's -- he didn't believe in it then
column7: and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare. Again
column8: don't take my word for it. The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals. The Catholic Health Association
column9: the AARP
column10: and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts
column11: possibly set up a two-tiered system
column12: and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have. Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future. We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan.

column2: they have no plan. They have absolutely no plan. The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan
column3: irrespective of the numbers
column4: it will grow at 7 or even more percent
column5: but that is beside the point. What has to be discussed is how we
column6: as a nation
column7: are going to create the size of an economy
column8: create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy. We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people. Another trillion dollars of revenue
column9: with which to save Medicare and Social Security. And you can't do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits
column10: as this administration is allowing to happen. That has to change
column11: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

column4: has to be viewed against the context of a $50-trillion U.S. economy output of goods and services over the next six years. A $550-billion tax cut in a $50-trillion economy over six years is one-and-a-half percent
column5: and the only hole it would blow is a hole in the plans of this administration to try to tinker with the tax code and defend the indefensible. It would blow up the bureaucracy
column6: but you would expand the economy. That's important for America.

column1: We've passed the Taxpayer Bill of Rights. We have fought for new provisions that now make it possible to file over the telephone. We are fighting for tax reforms across-the-board
column2: and most importantly
column3: we have a plan on the table right now to cut taxes on middle income families with several specific provisions. We already cut taxes on 15 million working families in this county
column4: with an average of about $1
column5: 000 in tax relief to those making $25
column6: 000 a year or less. And for the last two years
column7: we have had middle-income tax cuts on the table in the Congress and they would not -- they weren't accepted by Bob Dole and Newt Gingrich
column8: because they said they would not pass them without cutting deeply into Medicare
column9: Medicaid
column10: education and the environment. We are determined to move forward during these next four years
column11: with the tax cuts that president Bill Clinton has proposed. Here they are again: A $1500 tax credit for tuition
column13: 000 tax deduction so that no family pays taxes on the money for college tuition
column14: capital gains eliminated for the sale of a home
column15: a tax break for first-time home buyers and for health care expenses and a $500 child tax credit.

column1: You only get a tax cut in the Clinton administration if you do exactly what Al Gore and Bill Clinton want you to do. That's not America. When John F. Kennedy cut tax rates
column2: the economy grew
column3: unemployment went down and we balanced the budget
column4: and revenues went up. Indeed
column5: the Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy and the Deputy Secretary of Treasury under John F. Kennedy endorsed Bob Dole's plan to cut rates
column6: cut the Capital Gains Tax
column7: balance the budget
column8: provide a $500 tax credit
column9: and
column10: clearly
column11: the plan should be to lift the economy
column12: to get more revenues. Medicare will be saved because it will be put into a commission where both Bill Clinton and Bob Dole recognize it has to be studied by the same people that would study -- or did study
column13: I should say
column14: the Social Security System and saved it in 1983 and '84. Look
column15: we can bring down government -- the growth of government spending
column16: but we have to grow the economy. And in Bob Dole and Jack Kemp's opinion
column17: we should aim at doubling the size of the American economy in the next 15 years. Under their policies
column18: it will take 30 to 40 years. That's not acceptable.

column1: The chairman of their national campaign steering committee
column2: Senator D'Amato
column3: said that Bob Dole would have to cut into Medicare in order to pay for this proposal
column4: but that he would wait until after the election to do it. The proposal to cut Medicare that Senator Dole pushed before
column5: and shut down the government to try to enact
column6: would have already raised by $268
column7: the fees paid by the average couple now on Medicare. He tried to double the deductibles and give people less in return. We have a balanced budget plan that protects Medicare and gives tax cuts.

column2: Jim
column3: let me just say it is disgraceful
column4: the campaign being waged to scare the American senior citizens
column5: in this state and my home state of
column6: well
column7: New York and California
column8: about Medicare.

column2: isn't there?
Maryland now. The amount of money being spent to try to mislead the American people is demagoguery
column3: and only in the Clinton White House and in Al Gore's mind could an increase in spending per capita on a senior citizen from $4800 in 1996 to $7200 over the next five years be considered a cut. Does anybody think that Bob Dole
column4: who almost gave his life for his country
column5: who has served in the Senate
column6: who helped save Social Security
column7: crawled out of a fox hole on Riva Ridge in Northern Italy in 1945 to save a wounded radioman? Does anybody think in this country that he could possibly want to move our country ahead and leave anybody behind? Of course
column8: we can balance the budget. Of course
column9: we have to hold down the growth in entitlement spending. But clearly
column10: you cannot balance the budget
column11: Jim
column12: without growing this economy. It's only growing at about two-and-a-half percent. We should double the rate of growth and double the size of American economy. This means more jobs
column13: more wealth
column14: more income and more capital
column15: particularly for our nation's poor and those left behind.

column2: our balanced budget plan extends the Medicare Trust Fund ten years into the future. A commission is fine
column3: but a commission would not do any good if we adopted this risky $550-billion tax scheme. The word ""scary"" has been used. A couple of days ago I went with Governor Lawton Chiles
column4: who was here
column5: to Sarasota to the Friendship Senior Center. I talked with a woman there named Dorothy Wornell and she said
column6: ""You know
column7: we may not be as sophisticated as some of those people in Washington
column8: but we can add and subtract."" Here are the numbers she's adding and subtracting. Bob Dole's plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple
column9: and his plan would have doubled deductibles. It would have cost an extra $1
column10: 700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors. Bill Clinton prevented it from happening. We will never allow that to happen.

column2: Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue. It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight. By the President's own trustees of Medicare
column3: three members of which serve in his cabinet
column4: it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998. Something must be done. Bob Dole is -- has suggested a commission
column5: but
column6: clearly
column7: you cannot save Medicare
column8: Social Security
column9: or any program for the social welfare net of American people
column10: under which they should not be allowed to fall
column11: unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today. That is the issue
column12: not scaring people in America.

column2: as I said before
column3: he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole. He said that Bob Dole's solution for every single problem was to increase taxes. He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world
column4: but let's get to the point. Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965. Bob Dole
column5: incidentally
column6: just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place. I don't think he's -- he didn't believe in it then
column7: and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare. Again
column8: don't take my word for it. The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals. The Catholic Health Association
column9: the AARP
column10: and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts
column11: possibly set up a two-tiered system
column12: and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have. Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future. We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan.

column2: they have no plan. They have absolutely no plan. The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan
column3: irrespective of the numbers
column4: it will grow at 7 or even more percent
column5: but that is beside the point. What has to be discussed is how we
column6: as a nation
column7: are going to create the size of an economy
column8: create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy. We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people. Another trillion dollars of revenue
column9: with which to save Medicare and Social Security. And you can't do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits
column10: as this administration is allowing to happen. That has to change
column11: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

column17: we should aim at doubling the size of the American economy in the next 15 years. Under their policies
column18: it will take 30 to 40 years. That's not acceptable.

column1: The chairman of their national campaign steering committee
column2: Senator D'Amato
column3: said that Bob Dole would have to cut into Medicare in order to pay for this proposal
column4: but that he would wait until after the election to do it. The proposal to cut Medicare that Senator Dole pushed before
column5: and shut down the government to try to enact
column6: would have already raised by $268
column7: the fees paid by the average couple now on Medicare. He tried to double the deductibles and give people less in return. We have a balanced budget plan that protects Medicare and gives tax cuts.

column2: Jim
column3: let me just say it is disgraceful
column4: the campaign being waged to scare the American senior citizens
column5: in this state and my home state of
column6: well
column7: New York and California
column8: about Medicare.

column2: isn't there?
Maryland now. The amount of money being spent to try to mislead the American people is demagoguery
column3: and only in the Clinton White House and in Al Gore's mind could an increase in spending per capita on a senior citizen from $4800 in 1996 to $7200 over the next five years be considered a cut. Does anybody think that Bob Dole
column4: who almost gave his life for his country
column5: who has served in the Senate
column6: who helped save Social Security
column7: crawled out of a fox hole on Riva Ridge in Northern Italy in 1945 to save a wounded radioman? Does anybody think in this country that he could possibly want to move our country ahead and leave anybody behind? Of course
column8: we can balance the budget. Of course
column9: we have to hold down the growth in entitlement spending. But clearly
column10: you cannot balance the budget
column11: Jim
column12: without growing this economy. It's only growing at about two-and-a-half percent. We should double the rate of growth and double the size of American economy. This means more jobs
column13: more wealth
column14: more income and more capital
column15: particularly for our nation's poor and those left behind.

column2: our balanced budget plan extends the Medicare Trust Fund ten years into the future. A commission is fine
column3: but a commission would not do any good if we adopted this risky $550-billion tax scheme. The word ""scary"" has been used. A couple of days ago I went with Governor Lawton Chiles
column4: who was here
column5: to Sarasota to the Friendship Senior Center. I talked with a woman there named Dorothy Wornell and she said
column6: ""You know
column7: we may not be as sophisticated as some of those people in Washington
column8: but we can add and subtract."" Here are the numbers she's adding and subtracting. Bob Dole's plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple
column9: and his plan would have doubled deductibles. It would have cost an extra $1
column10: 700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors. Bill Clinton prevented it from happening. We will never allow that to happen.

column2: Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue. It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight. By the President's own trustees of Medicare
column3: three members of which serve in his cabinet
column4: it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998. Something must be done. Bob Dole is -- has suggested a commission
column5: but
column6: clearly
column7: you cannot save Medicare
column8: Social Security
column9: or any program for the social welfare net of American people
column10: under which they should not be allowed to fall
column11: unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today. That is the issue
column12: not scaring people in America.

column2: as I said before
column3: he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole. He said that Bob Dole's solution for every single problem was to increase taxes. He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world
column4: but let's get to the point. Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965. Bob Dole
column5: incidentally
column6: just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place. I don't think he's -- he didn't believe in it then
column7: and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare. Again
column8: don't take my word for it. The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals. The Catholic Health Association
column9: the AARP
column10: and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts
column11: possibly set up a two-tiered system
column12: and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have. Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future. We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan.

column2: they have no plan. They have absolutely no plan. The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan
column3: irrespective of the numbers
column4: it will grow at 7 or even more percent
column5: but that is beside the point. What has to be discussed is how we
column6: as a nation
column7: are going to create the size of an economy
column8: create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy. We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people. Another trillion dollars of revenue
column9: with which to save Medicare and Social Security. And you can't do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits
column10: as this administration is allowing to happen. That has to change
column11: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

column8: but we can add and subtract."" Here are the numbers she's adding and subtracting. Bob Dole's plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple
column9: and his plan would have doubled deductibles. It would have cost an extra $1
column10: 700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors. Bill Clinton prevented it from happening. We will never allow that to happen.

column2: Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue. It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight. By the President's own trustees of Medicare
column3: three members of which serve in his cabinet
column4: it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998. Something must be done. Bob Dole is -- has suggested a commission
column5: but
column6: clearly
column7: you cannot save Medicare
column8: Social Security
column9: or any program for the social welfare net of American people
column10: under which they should not be allowed to fall
column11: unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today. That is the issue
column12: not scaring people in America.

column2: as I said before
column3: he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole. He said that Bob Dole's solution for every single problem was to increase taxes. He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world
column4: but let's get to the point. Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965. Bob Dole
column5: incidentally
column6: just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place. I don't think he's -- he didn't believe in it then
column7: and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare. Again
column8: don't take my word for it. The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals. The Catholic Health Association
column9: the AARP
column10: and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts
column11: possibly set up a two-tiered system
column12: and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have. Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future. We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan.

column2: they have no plan. They have absolutely no plan. The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan
column3: irrespective of the numbers
column4: it will grow at 7 or even more percent
column5: but that is beside the point. What has to be discussed is how we
column6: as a nation
column7: are going to create the size of an economy
column8: create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy. We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people. Another trillion dollars of revenue
column9: with which to save Medicare and Social Security. And you can't do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits
column10: as this administration is allowing to happen. That has to change
column11: and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

We've seen the unemployment rate come down dramatically. We've seen the African-American unemployment rate go below double digits for the first time in 25 years and it stayed below for 25 months in a row. We have empowerment zones and enterprise communities

We want to do that for millions more all across the country.

column1: I think Mr. Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of -- to 6 percent or whatever you said. I believe you were referring to the ""Money"" magazine interview
column2: and the publisher of ""Money"" magazine just sent Mr. Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing ""Money"" magazine. It is not what the President said. It is not the President's position. Let me make clear what his position is. We will save Medicare. We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare
column3: and we'll do it within a balanced budget plan.

column2: but for the record
column3: I would like to release the letter to our friends in the press of the letter I got from ""Money"" magazine
column4: suggesting that Bill Clinton wanted and did lower the cost of living allowance for senior citizens as a way of reducing Social Security.

Americans, white and black, Jew and Christian, immigrant and nativeborn, to sit down and talk and listen and begin to understand what its like to come from that different perspective', 'Our country is as the Kerner Commission Report suggested a number of years ago was being split, but they said between white and black', 'I think its being split, Jim, not so much between white and black, although thats still a very serious problem', 'We really have two economies', 'Our general economy, our national economy, our mainstream economy is democratic, is based on incentives, a small d Al, its capitalism and incentives for working and saving and investing and producing, and families and the things that really lead to progress up that ladder that we call The American Dream, but is what is really universal', 'But unfortunately, in urban America, and I was glad to hear the Vice President talk a little bit about it, uh there  they have abandoned the inner cities', 'Theres a socialist economy', 'Theres no private housing', 'Theres mostly public housing', 'Youre told where to go to school, youre told what to buy with food stamps', 'It is a welfare system that is more like a thirdworld socialist country than what we would expect from the worlds greatest democratic freeenterprise system', 'That must change, and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp', 'Remember what I said just a moment ago', 'If it were not so, he would have told you', 'The problems between races in America must be addressed', 'The good news is were making progress', 'Weve seen 105 million new jobs created in the last four years', 'Weve seen the unemployment rate come down dramatically', 'Weve seen the AfricanAmerican unemployment rate go below double digits for the first time in 25 years and it stayed below for 25 months in a row', 'We have empowerment zones and enterprise communities, 105 of them in communities all across the United States of America', 'Let me tell you a story about Joann Crowder in Detroit', 'She was on welfare for eight years until the empowerment zone was created there', 'She just got a job in the new business that  that launched its enterprise right in that empowerment zone', 'We want to do that for millions more all across the country', 'Well, with all due respect, Jim, there are nine empowerment zones, a few little tinkering with tax credits around the country for inner cities', 'Los Angeles, after the riots, did not even get an empowerment zone, believe it or not', 'That is just unconscionable in America to have left Watts, South Central and East LA out', 'Earl Graves of Black Enterprise magazine said the single greatest deterrent to black advancement is the lack of access to capital, the credit and ownership', 'That will change', 'We will greenline every city in the United States where there is unemployment and welfare and we will eliminate the Capital Gains Tax, eliminate the tax on a welfare mother that takes a job', 'That is the answer', 'Give ownership and entrepreneurship to low income people based on need, not the color of their skin', 'Before I answer that specific question, let me say that we did put an empowerment zone in South Central, Los Angeles', 'It is in the form of the largest community development financial institution ever created in the United States or in any other country and it is creating jobs in South Central, Los Angeles right now', 'The Congress passed uh an enterprise zone after the Los Angeles riots five years ago', 'It was vetoed by the prior administration', 'Now, to your question', 'We have a specific plan to create 1 million new jobs in the inner cities of America with tax credits for employers who hire people coming off welfare, cause weve passed welfare reform now, we promised to end welfare as we know it', 'And we are implementing this new legislation', 'We have moved 19 million people off of the welfare rolls and into good jobs in the last four years', 'Our new plan is to have 1 million more jobs in the inner cities, but thats not all', 'We are also implementing the plan to put 100,000 community police officers in our cities', 'Weve already got 20,000 out there', 'Were ahead of our sixyear schedule', 'As a matter of fact, therere 8 here in St Petersburg, already on the beat, you may run into one of them leaving this auditorium tonight', 'St Petersburg is safer because of this urban agenda that were following', 'We want the focus to be on millions more jobs, and were very optimistic that its gonna happen', 'Well, weve had four years and theres no enterprise zone', 'There are empowerment zones, but you have to do what Bill Clinton and Al Gore want you to do', 'You get a $5,000 tax credit if you hire somebody thats unemployed, but youve already got to have an existing business', 'The answer is to say, once again, greenline any area in America that has been redlined for lack of mortgage money, lack of credit and capital', 'Just say that area qualifies for no Capital Gains Tax, zero, nada', 'Thats what Eleanor Holmes Norton wants to do in the District of Columbia and this administration said to DC, Drop dead', 'Drop dead', 'We dont want to change the legislation that would lower the tax rate in DC, allow welfare mothers to take a job without any tax on the first 90 percent of her income and no Capital Gain Tax that should be done in every urban area of America that would make capital flow back, and you cant have capitalism, Al, without capital', 'You may want to give a tax credit, but it wont work', 'Well, we have 105 empowerment zones and enterprise communities all across the United States of America, and with all due respect, thats 105 more than were there when we came into the White House', 'We have been implementing them in a determined way', 'They are making a difference', 'You know, that empowerment zone that I mentioned in Detroit is creating jobs not only for Joann Crowder, who feels proud that shes off of welfare now, and were proud of her', 'Its creating jobs for hundreds of others, and similar initiatives are working in the other empowerment zones', 'The single greatest problem in our opinion, domestic  in the domestic economy, is that this tax code, 83 years old, a relic of the Cold War and Hot War, inflation and depression, sevenandahalf million words long, overtaxes capital, overtaxes working men and women and families', 'Clearly, the Gordian knot needs to be broken in one fell swoop', 'Bob Dole and Jack Kemp, as soon as we get through this first step of cutting tax rates across the board, are going to repeal the whole code while Bill Clinton and my friend, Al Gore, defend the status quo', 'Were going to repeal the sevenandahalf million words of the UStax code, make it tax income once, not twice, three, four, and if you die, it confiscates your estate', 'We must have a tax code going into the 21st Century that does not protect the establishment and this tax code does', 'And by cutting and eliminating the Capital Gains, by cutting and eliminating the Estate Tax, by bringing the top tax rate down to something reasonable, like  here he goes again  I think in peacetime, it shouldnt be higher, Bob, and I dont think it should be higher than 25 percent, phased in', 'But capital would flow out into the economy', 'We have people getting access to capital', 'Small businessmen and women, AfricanAmerican, Asian Americans, Latino Americans, female Americans would be able to start their businesses', 'Dana Crist of Lancaster said the day the tax bill is passed in Congress, she will open a new factory with 40 or 50 or 60 employees in Lancaster, Pennsylvania', 'Hell call that trickle down', 'Ill call it Niagara Falls', 'The problem with this version of Niagara Falls is that Senator Dole and Mr Kemp would put the economy in a barrel and send it over the falls', '[ Laughter ] It is a risky, $550billion tax scheme that actually raises taxes on 9 million of the hardest working families', 'Again, Mr Kemp opposed that and called it unconscionable', 'Now, it is part of the plan that he is supporting', 'Not only that, though, it would blow a hole in the deficit, it would raise interest rates', 'That means higher mortgage payments, particularly those with the variable rate mortgages, higher car payments, he would also lead to much deeper cuts in Medicare, Medicaid, education and the environment', 'It is extremely risky', 'And as for these harsh words, I dont take them personally', 'He said much worse about Bob Dole when he said Bob Dole never met a tax that he didnt hike', 'He wrote about 450 separate provisions in that code', 'You better check with him before you eliminate it completely', 'He may be getting royalties', 'Jim, a $550billion tax cut, this is something that Al does not want to mention, has to be viewed against the context of a $50trillion US economy output of goods and services over the next six years', 'A $550billion tax cut in a $50trillion economy over six years is oneandahalf percent, and the only hole it would blow is a hole in the plans of this administration to try to tinker with the tax code and defend the indefensible', 'It would blow up the bureaucracy, but you would expand the economy', 'Thats important for America', 'Weve passed the Taxpayer Bill of Rights', 'We have fought for new provisions that now make it possible to file over the telephone', 'We are fighting for tax reforms acrosstheboard, and most importantly, we have a plan on the table right now to cut taxes on middle income families with several specific provisions', 'We already cut taxes on 15 million working families in this county, with an average of about $1,000 in tax relief to those making $25,000 a year or less', 'And for the last two years, we have had middleincome tax cuts on the table in the Congress and they would not  they werent accepted by Bob Dole and Newt Gingrich, because they said they would not pass them without cutting deeply into Medicare, Medicaid, education and the environment', 'We are determined to move forward during these next four years, with the tax cuts that president Bill Clinton has proposed', 'Here they are again: A $1500 tax credit for tuition, a $10,000 tax deduction so that no family pays taxes on the money for college tuition, capital gains eliminated for the sale of a home, a tax break for firsttime home buyers and for health care expenses and a $500 child tax credit', 'You only get a tax cut in the Clinton administration if you do exactly what Al Gore and Bill Clinton want you to do', 'Thats not America', 'When John F Kennedy cut tax rates, the economy grew, unemployment went down and we balanced the budget, and revenues went up', 'Indeed, the Secretary of Treasury under John F Kennedy and the Deputy Secretary of Treasury under John F Kennedy endorsed Bob Doles plan to cut rates, cut the Capital Gains Tax, balance the budget, provide a $500 tax credit, and, clearly, the plan should be to lift the economy, to get more revenues', 'Medicare will be saved because it will be put into a commission where both Bill Clinton and Bob Dole recognize it has to be studied by the same people that would study  or did study, I should say, the Social Security System and saved it in 1983 and 84', 'Look, we can bring down government  the growth of government spending, but we have to grow the economy', 'And in Bob Dole and Jack Kemps opinion, we should aim at doubling the size of the American economy in the next 15 years', 'Under their policies, it will take 30 to 40 years', 'Thats not acceptable', 'The chairman of their national campaign steering committee, Senator DAmato, said that Bob Dole would have to cut into Medicare in order to pay for this proposal, but that he would wait until after the election to do it', 'The proposal to cut Medicare that Senator Dole pushed before, and shut down the government to try to enact, would have already raised by $268, the fees paid by the average couple now on Medicare', 'He tried to double the deductibles and give people less in return', 'We have a balanced budget plan that protects Medicare and gives tax cuts', 'Before I answer that, Jim, let me just say it is disgraceful, the campaign being waged to scare the American senior citizens, in this state and my home state of, well, New York and California, about Medicare', 'One other one in there, isnt there?', 'about Medicare Yeah, Maryland now', 'The amount of money being spent to try to mislead the American people is demagoguery, and only in the Clinton White House and in Al Gores mind could an increase in spending per capita on a senior citizen from $4800 in 1996 to $7200 over the next five years be considered a cut', 'Does anybody think that Bob Dole, who almost gave his life for his country, who has served in the Senate, who helped save Social Security, crawled out of a fox hole on Riva Ridge in Northern Italy in 1945 to save a wounded radioman?', 'Does anybody think in this country that he could possibly want to move our country ahead and leave anybody behind?', 'Of course, we can balance the budget', 'Of course, we have to hold down the growth in entitlement spending', 'But clearly, you cannot balance the budget, Jim, without growing this economy', 'Its only growing at about twoandahalf percent', 'We should double the rate of growth and double the size of American economy', 'This means more jobs, more wealth, more income and more capital, particularly for our nations poor and those left behind', 'Mr Lehrer, our balanced budget plan extends the Medicare Trust Fund ten years into the future', 'A commission is fine, but a commission would not do any good if we adopted this risky $550billion tax scheme', 'The word scary has been used', 'A couple of days ago I went with Governor Lawton Chiles, who was here, to Sarasota to the Friendship Senior Center', 'I talked with a woman there named Dorothy Wornell and she said, You know, we may not be as sophisticated as some of those people in Washington, but we can add and subtract', 'Here are the numbers shes adding and subtracting', 'Bob Doles plan would have already imposed an extra $268 on the average Medicare receiving couple, and his plan would have doubled deductibles', 'It would have cost an extra $1,700 over the lifetime of his plan and eliminated nursing home standards and guarantees of nursing home care for seniors', 'Bill Clinton prevented it from happening', 'We will never allow that to happen', 'Jim, Medicare is too important to senior citizens around this country to play the type of politics that is being played on this issue', 'It is losing $8 billion as we stand here tonight', 'By the Presidents own trustees of Medicare, three members of which serve in his cabinet, it will be losing $23 billion a year by 1998', 'Something must be done', 'Bob Dole is  has suggested a commission, but, clearly, you cannot save Medicare, Social Security, or any program for the social welfare net of American people, under which they should not be allowed to fall, unless we grow this economy at least twice the rate it is growing today', 'That is the issue, not scaring people in America', 'Well, as I said before, he used much harsher language when he talked about Bob Dole', 'He said that Bob Doles solution for every single problem was to increase taxes', 'He said just two years ago that the Bob Dole tax increase of 1982 was the largest tax increase in the history of the world, but lets get to the point', 'Medicare has been adjusted 23 times since it was created in 1965', 'Bob Dole, incidentally, just bragged this year that he was one of only 12 people who voted against the creation of Medicare in the first place', 'I dont think hes  he didnt believe in it then, and the plan that he promoted last year would have certainly been devastating to Medicare', 'Again, dont take my word for it', 'The American Hospital Association said it could have closed 700 hospitals', 'The Catholic Health Association, the AARP, and many other groups who pay careful attention to Medicare said that the Dole/Gingrich plan on Medicare would have led to deep cuts, possibly set up a twotiered system, and would have ended the kind of Medicare system that we have', 'Our plan extends Medicare ten years into the future', 'We will always protect Medicare within the context of a balanced budget plan', 'Folks, they have no plan', 'They have absolutely no plan', 'The President himself suggested that the reduction in the growth of Medicare over the next five or six years ought to be held to 6 percent under the Republican plan, irrespective of the numbers, it will grow at 7 or even more percent, but that is beside the point', 'What has to be discussed is how we, as a nation, are going to create the size of an economy, create a national wealth that would at least double this 6 or 7 trillion economy', 'We would have $6 trillion in 15 years extra wealth for the American people', 'Another trillion dollars of revenue, with which to save Medicare and Social Security', 'And you cant do it with a tax code and a regulatory code and people suing each other with frivolous suits, as this administration is allowing to happen', 'That has to change, and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp', 'I think Mr Kemp has unintentionally made a mistake in saying that President Clinton called for reduction of  to 6 percent or whatever you said', 'I believe you were referring to the Money magazine interview, and the publisher of Money magazine just sent Mr Kemp a letter two days ago asking him to please stop inaccurately citing Money magazine', 'It is not what the President said', 'It is not the Presidents position', 'Let me make clear what his position is', 'We will save Medicare', 'We will stop efforts to hurt Medicare, and well do it within a balanced budget plan', 'I will answer the question, but for the record, I would like to release the letter to column1: Remember what I said just a moment ago. If it were not so
column2: he would have told you. The problems between races in America must be addressed. The good news is we're making progress. We've seen 10.5 million new jobs created in the last four years. We've seen the unemployment rate come down dramatically. We've seen the African-American unemployment rate go below double digits for the first time in 25 years and it stayed below for 25 months in a row. We have empowerment zones and enterprise communities
column3: 105 of them in communities all across the United States of America. Let me tell you a story about Joann Crowder in Detroit. She was on welfare for eight years until the empowerment zone was created there. She just got a job in the new business that -- that launched its enterprise right in that empowerment zone. We want to do that for millions more all across the country.

column2: with all due respect
column3: Jim
column4: there are nine empowerment zones

column6: after the riots

column12: not the color of their skin.

column1: Before I answer that specific question
column2: let me say that we did put an empowerment zone in South Central
column3: Los Angeles. It is in the form of the largest community development financial institution ever created in the United States or in any other country and it is creating jobs in South Central
column4: Los Angeles right now. The Congress passed uh an enterprise zone after the Los Angeles riots five years ago. It was vetoed by the prior administration. Now
column5: to your question. We have a specific plan to create 1 million new jobs in the inner cities of America with tax credits for employers who hire people coming off welfare
column6: 'cause we've passed welfare reform now
column7: we promised to end welfare as we know it. And we are implementing this new legislation. We have moved 1.9 million people off of the welfare rolls and into good jobs in the last four years. Our new plan is to have 1 million more jobs in the inner cities
column8: but that's not all. We are also implementing the plan to put 100
column9: 000 community police officers in our cities. We've already got 20
column10: 000 out there. We're ahead of our six-year schedule. As a matter of fact
column11: there're 8 here in St. Petersburg
column12: already on the beat
column13: you may run into one of them leaving this auditorium tonight. St. Petersburg is safer because of this urban agenda that we're following. We want the focus to be on millions more jobs
column14: and we're very optimistic that it's gonna happen.

column9: zero

column11: Drop dead. Drop dead. We don't want to change the legislation that would lower the tax rate in D.C.
